scenario_text.value:
This isn’t good, Takuma. Kaito still hasn’t
come back.
Huh... I wonder where he went.

I can’t believe I didn’t notice they were
gone sooner.

If I’d been keeping an eye out, this never
would’ve happened.

Where are you, Kaito? And why’d you disappear
like that?
Maybe the bad guys got a hold of him...
Don’t say that, Saki!

Sorry... But we have to consider the
possibility that something bad happened.

I mean, the last thing I want is for him to
die, but still...
It’s my fault for showing him that vision.
He’s gone because of me... I’m sorry.

Haru—I mean, Renamon—why are you in that
form, anyway?

We know who you really are now. You don’t
have to keep pretending to be him.

I’ve been in this form so long it just
started to feel natural.

There’s also the way Miyuki looks at me when
I’m in this form.

I just want to have her back at my side so
badly...
Renamon...
Do you mind, though, Professor?

If that’s how you’d prefer to be, then
I don’t mind one bit.
We understand how you feel, Renamon.

Sorry to rewind the conversation...but what
about Kaito?

I hounded you guys with those visions as part
of a deal with the Master.

I was trying to scare you so you’d be
swallowed up by the fog.

There must have been some memory in Kaito’s
vision that was too hard for him to face.

...So he ran off because he couldn’t deal
with it?

(Whatever the memory was, it must have been
something about Miu.)
In that case we are truly in a pickle.

When someone acts with intention, it is
possible to deduce where they may have gone.

But if he acted on impulse, there’s no
telling where Kaito might be now.
Oh, gosh! What should we do then?

I’m sorry for making this happen. I take all
the blame.

You believed it would help Miyuki. I can
understand that.

I might do the same if I thought it would
help Aoi.

Right. Anyway, now’s not the time for finger-
pointing.
What do you think we should do, Takuma?
Um, well, what are our options?

We could look for him, or forge ahead...but
we hardly have time for both.
What do you mean by “forge ahead”?

I mean prioritizing escaping with those of us
left. The first step is rescuing Miyuki.

As harsh as it sounds, that would also mean
giving up on the search for Kaito...

What?! We can’t just do that! I thought he
was one of us—our friend?!

We have to find him and go back together!
Right, everyone? RIGHT?
This is hard for me to say, Aoi, but...

I don’t think I can disagree with what the
professor is saying.
Not you, too, Saki...

I want Kaito to be safe. I want all of us to
make it back home together!

But it’s hard to imagine that Kaito wants the
same for us...
Ah...

We should at least consider the professor’s
suggestion instead of rejecting it outright.

But...I can’t accept the idea of just giving
up on Kaito. I just can’t.

(I see where both of them are coming from.
They want to prevent further loss of life...)

(And I don’t want to abandon Kaito either,
myself.)
Hang on a sec.
Did you think of a solution?

Not exactly. But Dracmon disappeared with
Kaito, right?

That means Dracmon is keeping him safe, same
as always.

True. Otherwise he would’ve abandoned Kaito,
like what I did that time.
Hm, you might be right...
So we can at least assume he’s still alive.

I’m more worried about Dracmon changing
forms. If Kaito is mentally unstable...

You mean he could transform into something
bad and attack Kaito?

And after Kaito, who do you think would be
next? Us.

(So that’s why the professor wants to leave
so badly...)

(He and Saki just don’t want any more of us
to die, probably.)

So we should find Kaito quickly to prevent
a negative transformation?

Yeah, that makes sense. I think we should
listen to Agumon.
Now’s not the time to abandon Kaito.

Fog taking over places, new buildings
appearing... This world’s changing fast.

We don’t know what’ll happen next, so I can
understand why the professor is worried.

We should prioritize safety and promise to
meet at the school if anything happens.

Sounds good to me. I don’t wanna give up on
him, either.

I understand, and I respect your opinions. So
of course, I’ll do what I can to help.

Right. If it’s possible to get Kaito back
safely, then we have to try.
We will find you, Kaito. I promise.

(We don’t have much time left. We have to
<color=#B41919>hurry</color> and find Kaito.)
